quote: Wisdom is like a baobab tree; no one individual can embrace it.

recipe.name: Jollof Rice
steps: Heat oil in a pot and sauté onions.
Add blended tomatoes and bell pepper; cook for 10 minutes.
Add thyme, curry, salt, and pepper.
Add rice and water; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer until rice is cooked.

quote: Patience is power; with time, even a small stone can carve a river.

recipe.name: Ugali
steps: Boil water in a pot with a pinch of salt.
Gradually add maize flour while stirring constantly.
Cook until thick and smooth, stirring continuously.
Serve hot with vegetables or meat stew.

quote: The child who is not embraced by the village will burn it down to feel its warmth.

recipe.name: Egusi Soup
steps: Heat palm oil in a pot and sauté onions.
Add ground egusi and cook for 5 minutes.
Add stock and bring to a boil.
Stir in spinach and crayfish; simmer for 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.

quote: Do not judge me by my success, judge me by how many times I fell and got back up again.

recipe.name: Bobotie
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
Sauté onions, add beef, and cook until browned.
Mix in soaked bread, curry, turmeric, salt, and pepper.
Transfer to a baking dish.
Whisk eggs and milk; pour over meat mixture.
Bake 30–40 minutes until golden.

quote: He who has health has hope, and he who has hope has everything.

recipe.name: Koshari
steps: Cook rice, lentils, and pasta separately.
Layer lentils, rice, and pasta in a serving dish.
Top with tomato sauce and fried onions.
Sprinkle cumin, salt, and pepper.
Serve hot.
